title: [BUG] System.DllNotFoundException: libSkiaSharp
body:
### Description

Started getting this runtime error after upgrading Blazor app from .Net 9 to .Net 10.
Tried with 3.116.1 and 3.119.2-preview1 (which is the latest at the moment). .Net 9 app worked with 3.116.1

### Code

The best way to share code for larger projects is a link to a GitHub repository: https://github.com/user/repo/tree/bug-123

But, you can also share a short block of code here:
```cs
// some C# code here
```
You can also share some XAML:
```xaml
<!-- xaml code here -->
```


### Expected Behavior

SkiaSharp should work

### Actual Behavior

Not working, runtime error System.DllNotFoundException: libSkiaSharp

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

### IDE / Editor

Other (Please indicate in the description)

### Platform / Operating System

Blazor, WASM

### Platform / Operating System Version

_No response_

### Devices

_No response_

### Relevant Screenshots

_No response_

### Relevant Log Output

```shell

```

This issue is not classified as a regression but highlights a critical runtime error associated with native components.

Additional remarks:
* Despite the applied labels, they may not align with the specific issue regarding the runtime error with SkiaSharp, and no backend-related labels were mentioned.

<details>
<summary>Detailed Summary and Actions</summary>

- The issue occurs in a Windows environment, specifically Windows-Classic.
- It involves a runtime error related to the SkiaSharp library, indicating a DllNotFoundException for its native component.
- The issue focuses on application reliability due to crashes or unexpected behaviors stemming from a missing DLL.

Summary of the actions that will be performed:
